page.title: 11CUSTOMS IN BERROW
page.content: Customs in Berrow centre on the church. Many people come to{Harvest {Festival}Services and Pendock Parish shares a Harvest Supper held in Berrow Church Hall. A summer{fete}is held annually to raise money for the Church and consists of various stalls with home-made goods, jumble, produce, supported by games and raffles with some form of entertainment. Also connected with the Church is the{Nan-Fan Sermon.}In 1745 Susannah Cocks Nan-Fan left a legacy of Â£4O to be put "out to interest". 1O shillings of this was to be paid to the minister yearly in perpetuity if a sermon was preached on February 5th every year: the rest was to go to the poor. This was as thanks for "deliverance from the violent designs of an unnatural enemy". This still takes place.
